intro: Bigelowia pluriflora, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Astereaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and forested areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its fibrous leaves have been historically used by Māori for weaving and crafting. Bigelowia pluriflora is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
